page.title: 02Library,Sherburn-in-Elmet.
page.content: {Sherburn In Elmet County Library.}The library is situated in a cul-de-sac off Finkle Hill. It is open Tuesday,Thursday,Friday and Saturday mornings and Monday,Tuesday,Thursday and Friday afternoons and early evenings.The busiest times are Saturday mornings and Thursday and Friday evenings.About 4,000 people borrow books. It also serves villages from the southern boundary of North Yorkshire to the York boundary with two mobile vans. Seven people work in the library and there are 10,000 books in reserve.They also have a delivery van which brings books that have been requested from other libraries and vice-versa.The library was opened on Sept.3rd. 1963 by West Riding County Councillor Mrs.Nellie Fortune.It has three different sections,reference, adult and junior.
